default: (a) {@filter martial weapon|items|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and {@item shield|phb} or (b) {@filter two martial weapons|items|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item crossbow bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) five {@item javelin|phb|javelins}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

entries.name: The Magus
entries: As the swordsman made his way through the busy marketplace, his eyes flashed green for a brief moment. He could see the unmistakable aura of arcane magic surrounding the humble dwarf shopping for wares. He had found his target. As the warrior drew his blade, what had appeared to be a mere dwarf peasant seconds before reverted to its true form. As the demon lunged forward, the swordsman met claw with his blade.

The assassin watched as the Duke walked the streets with a single guard at his side. As the would-be assassin's blade darted toward the Duke's exposed neck, glee turned to fear as the armored guard appeared where the Duke had been moments before. Before the killer could react, a blade of emerald flame had pierced his chest.

The halfling knelt before the three hooded figures that stood before her. She had spent nearly two years of her life searching for a member of this secret order, and now she had found three. Consumed by sorrow after her father's death at the hands of a wicked sorcerer, the young halfling swore she would do whatever it took to gain the power to exact her revenge. Now that the moment was at hand, she swore fealty to the secretive order, offering up her life in return for power.
All three of the warriors described above are Magi, users of sword and spell, weaving both together in a deadly dance.

entries.name: Sword & Spell
entries: Known by many names throughout the multiverse, those who are able to wield both sword and spell are collectively known as Magi. Rather than dedicate their lives to studying arcane magic or mastering martial techniques, Magi are dedicated to a middle path. Though they may never command the earth-shattering magic of an archmage, or go toe to toe with a true master of the blade, a Magus is able to master a unique form of arcane combat only used by the members of their Order.

Their signature style of magic allows them to channel spells through their weapon strikes, sense the presence of arcane magic in the world around them, and even strike the weaves of spells from the air before they can take effect.

entries.name: Secret Orders
entries: The magic of the Magi is not something everyone can learn. Over time, these arcane warriors have organized themselves into clandestine societies, content to operate in the shadows. Potential Magi are often identified from a young age and are inducted into an Order only after they have proven their skill and dedication. While some Orders are more secretive than others, nearly every Order of Magi is thought to be nothing more than legend to the vast majority common folk.

As Magi rise through the ranks of their secret society, they are expected to infiltrate and form relationships with those in positions of power. They often set themselves up as personal advisors, guards, and consorts to influential nobles, powerful archmages, and wealthy merchants. Though Magi may form relationships, their primary loyalty is always to their Order.

entries.name: Creating Your Magus
entries: Those who pursue life as a Magus often give up everything in order to be accepted and trained by a master. What motivates your Magus? Have you always had an unquenchable thirst for knowledge and skill? Was one of your loved ones slain by an evil mage, setting you on the path of revenge, no matter the personal cost? Or, do you simply desire to increase your skill with both sword and sorcery in tandem with one another?

Also, decide where you acquired your training as a Magi. Are you an initiate in a secret society of arcane warriors? Or, were you trained in secret by a renegade member of an order of powerful magi who work to control the world? Maybe you were raised from birth so as to perfectly develop your talent in the art of war alongside your arcane potential.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Magus quickly by using these suggestions. First, depending on the weapons you wish to use, make your Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score, followed by your Intelligence. Second, choose the {@background Sage} background.

classFeature.name: Arcane Armory
entries: At 1st level, you learn the signature enchantment of the Magi, marking you as a member of their ranks. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can touch one melee weapon, shield, or set of armor to perform a ritual adding the item to your Arcane Armory. Your Arcane Armory is an extradimensional space that only its Magus can access.
Objects in your Arcane Armory gain the following benefits:

items: They count as magical weapons, shields, or sets of armor.
You can use your Intelligence, in place of Dexterity, when calculating Armor Class in this light and medium armor, so long as you do not already add it to your Armor Class.
As a bonus action, you can shunt or summon any number of objects of your choice from within your Arcane Armory, instantly equipping, donning, or doffing those items.

entries: Your Arcane Armory can hold a total number of objects equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of 1) at one time, but one of those objects must always be a weapon. If you perform this ritual on another object while the Armory is at its maximum, one object of your choice is removed.

entries.name: Arcane Armory & Antimagic Effects
entries: The effects of the {@spell antimagic field} spell, and other similar effects, suppress the effects of your Arcane Armory while you are within the area of anitmagic.

activation.condition: Can be during a short or long rest

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 1st level, you adopt a Fighting Style that best reflects your training. You cannot select a Fighting Style more than once, even if a feature allows you to select another Fighting Style.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can switch your Fighting Style for another Fighting Style of your choice.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: At 2nd level, you have learned to cast arcane spells, much like a {@class Wizard}, which you use to enhance your abilities in combat:

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Magus spell list, which can be found at the end of this class description. You learn another Magus cantrip at 4th and 10th level, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Magus table.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use any weapon or shield within your {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1} as a spellcasting focus for your Magus spells. They can also be used to perform the somatic components of Magus spells.
You can also use an {@item Arcane Focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Magus table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st-level and higher. To cast a spell you know, you must expend a spell slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots each time you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known Of 1st-Level And Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the Magus spell list. The Spells Known column of the Magus table shows when you learn more Magus spells. Each Magus spell you learn must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 6th level, you learn a spell of your choice from the Magus spell list of either 1st-level or 2nd-level.
Whenever you gain a Magus level, you can choose one Magus spell you know and replace it with another Magus spell of your choice, of a level that you have spell slots for.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: As you commit your spells to memory, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Magus spells. Use Intelligence when a spell refers to your spellcasting ability, when you set a saving throw DC, or when you make a spell attack roll.

classFeature.name: Spellstrike
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you learn to channel your spells through weapons. Once per turn when you would make an attack, you can cast a Magus spell, expending a spell slot as normal, and make an attack with a melee {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1} weapon. To be channeled through a Spellstrike attack in this way, the spell must meet the following requirements:

items: The Magus spell must have a casting time of 1 action.
The Magus spell must require a single spell attack roll, force its target to make a saving throw, or affect a total number of hit points worth of creatures (like {@spell sleep}).

entries: If your attack misses, the spell fails and has no effect. On a hit, the spell takes effect immediately after the normal effects and damage of your weapon attack, using the rules below:

entries.name: Area of Effect
entries: If the spell targets an area greater than a 10-foot cube, it takes effect as a 15-foot cone originating from you, which must include your target, or it is contained to only affect the target of your attack (your choice on hit).

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You do not deal the damage of the cantrip along with the damage of your weapon attack. Instead, your weapon attack deals the damage type dealt by the cantrip, and applies the cantrip's additional effects, other than damage, on hit.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: If the spell requires your {@status concentration}, you must concentrate on it as soon as it takes effect on hit.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If the spell requires a saving throw when cast, the target makes the initial saving throw at disadvantage on hit. If you score a critical hit on the attack, it automatically fails this saving throw. Other targets (if any) save as normal.

entries.name: Spell Attacks
entries: If the spell requires a spell attack roll, it instantly takes effect when you hit with your weapon attack.

activation.condition: Once per turn when you would make an attack

classFeature.name: Arcane Regeneration
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can meditate on your knowledge of the arcane to regenerate magic potential. During a short rest, you can recover spell slots of a combined level equal to your Intelligence modifier. Once you do so, you must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

classFeature.name: Esoteric Order
entries: At 3rd level, choose the Esoteric Order that best represents your Magus' skills: the Orders of Arcanists, Arcane Archers, Blade Dancers, Scales, Shades, Spellbreakers, or Warders.
Your Esoteric Order grants you features at 3rd level, and again when you reach 7th, 15th, and 20th level in this class.

entries.name: Order Spells
entries: Most Esoteric Orders include a list of Order Spells that you learn at the Magus levels noted in your Order's description. These Order Spells count as Magus spells for you, but they do not count against your number of Magus Spells Known.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.
You can still only make one {@classFeature Spellstrike|Magus|LLMC|2} attack per turn.

classFeature.name: Spellsight
entries: Also at 5th level, you can use an action awaken your senses to the presence of magic within 30 feet as if you had cast {@spell detect magic}. While this sense is active, you can touch an object and gain knowledge as if you had cast {@spell identify}. This special sense requires your {@status concentration}, and it lasts for 1 minute.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can focus residual power from spells to slip through the Ethereal Plane. On your turn, immediately before or after you cast a Magus spell or {@classFeature Spellstrike|Magus|LLMC|2}, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet.
The range of this feature is 10 feet, plus an extra 10 feet for each level of the spell slot you expended (maximum 60 feet).

activation.condition: On your turn, immediately before or after you cast a Magus spell or Spellstrike

classFeature.name: Esoteric Order Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Esoteric Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Spellsunder
entries: You can use {@classFeature Spellstrike|Magus|LLMC|2} to cut down hostile spells. Starting at 9th level, when you see a creature cast a spell that will affect you, you can use a reaction to expend a spell slot and use an {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1} weapon to attack the spell as it takes effect.

If the spell was cast at a level equal to the level of the spell slot you expended or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If it was cast at a level higher than the slot you expended, make an attack roll with your weapon. If your attack roll exceeds 12 + twice the level of the spell, the spell fails and has no effect.

activation.condition: When you see a creature cast a spell that will affect you

classFeature.name: Mystical Ward
entries: You can cast your spells in battle and avoid their most potent effects. Beginning at 10th level, you are immune to the effects of any Magus spell you cast, unless you wish to be affected.

classFeature.name: Arcane Conservation
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you use {@classFeature Spellstrike|Magus|LLMC|2} and miss with your weapon attack, you can regain one expended spell slot. When you do so, you cannot also use {@classFeature Ethereal Jaunt|Magus|LLMC|6}.
The spell slot you regain with this feature must be a lower level than the slot you expended as part of your Spellstrike.
At 18th level, you regain the same spell slot you expended.

activation.condition: When you use Spellstrike and miss with your weapon attack

classFeature.name: Prismatic Strikes
entries: Your weapons are infused with the arcane power you channel through them. Starting at 11th level, your attacks with {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1} weapons deal a bonus {@damage 1d8} damage on hit.
This bonus damage must be the damage type dealt by a Magus spell you know, and it can be chosen on hit.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Superior Spellsunder
entries: Starting at 14th level, when a creature you can see within 30 feet is targeted by a spell you can see, you can use a reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it and use your {@classFeature Spellsunder|Magus|LLMC|9} reaction against the triggering spell.

activation.condition: When a creature you can see within 30 feet is targeted by a spell you can see

classFeature.name: Esoteric Order Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Esoteric Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Esoteric Order Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Esoteric Order.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Arcanists
entries: Magi who join the Order of Arcanists often find themselves in the service of Wizards and other learned practitioners of the arcane arts. While most Magi only study magic for its uses in combat, those who join this Order explore the broader uses of arcane magic, and will go so far as to keep a spellbook and learn rituals that will aid in their quest for knowledge.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Armory
entries: Your Order has taught you to expand your {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1} to hold more than the armaments of war. You can perform your Arcane Armory ritual on potions, spell scrolls, staffs, wands, Tiny wondrous items, and other Tiny items, storing them in your Arcane Armory. As normal, you can use a bonus action to shunt or summon these items from your Arcane Armory, but you must have a free hand to do so.

Also, the maximum number of objects you can have as part of your Arcane Armory is equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) + your Magus level. All other rules for your Arcane Armory still apply.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Spellbook
entries: Unlike other Magi who memorize spells for use in battle, you maintain a spellbook from which you can prepare spells:

entries.name: Spellbook
entries: You gain a Spellbook that contains a number of spells of your choice equal to your number of Spells Known, which replace your current Spells Known. You choose these new spells from the Magus or Wizard spell list, but they must be of a level that you have the spell slots for as shown on the Magus table. Your Arcane Spellbook is a Tiny item that can be enchanted as part of your Arcane Armory.

entries.name: Preparing Spells
entries: Over the course of a long rest, you can spend 1 hour preparing your spells for the day. You prepare a number of spells from your Spellbook equal to half your level (rounded down) + your Intelligence modifier. These are the only spells that you can cast until you prepare different spells, and while prepared they count as Magus spells for you.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast the ritual version of any spell in your Spellbook even if you do not have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Learning New Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Magus level, you add another Magus or Wizard spell of your choice to your Spellbook. It must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

You can also copy any Magus or Wizard spell from a spell scroll or Spellbook into your Aracane Spellbook by spending 1 hour and 10 gold for rare inks, per spell level, so long as the spell is of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: War Magic
entries: You can seamlessly weave minor spells with weapon attacks. Whenever you use your action to cast a Magus spell you can make a weapon attack as a bonus action on that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Esoteric Sight
entries: The duration of your Spellsight increases to 10 minutes, it no longer requires {@status concentration}, and while it is active you gain {@sense Truesight} out to a 30-foot radius and you have advantage on any weapon attack rolls you make as part of {@classFeature Spellsunder|Magus|LLMC|9}.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Arcanist
entries: You wield arcane magic that rivals an archmage. You add one 6th-level and one 7th-level Wizard spell of your choice to your Spellbook. You can cast each spell once without expending a spell slot, and regain the ability to do so after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Arcane Archers
entries: Originally founded by a sect of elvish mage hunters, the Magi known as Arcane Archers are masters of bow, arrow and spell. While most Magi thrive in close-quarters combat, Arcane Archers strike at foes from afar, raining magic arrows down on foes. Most members of this Order are guardians, but some Arcane Archers strike out as adventurers.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer Spells
entries: When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with an evocation spell of the same level of your choice from either the Magus or Sorcerer spell list.

rows: {@spell Melf's acid arrow|phb|acid arrow}, {@spell cordon of arrows (alternate)|llspell}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Quiver
entries: You have learned to use the signature enchantments of the Magi with ranged weapons. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can add ranged weapons and quivers containing up to 20 pieces of ammunition each to your {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1}.
You can use {@classFeature Spellstrike|Magus|LLMC|2} with ranged weapons that are part of your Arcane Armory. However, any spells that have an area of effect are contained to only affect your target.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanted Shot
entries: When you make an attack roll with a ranged {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1} weapon and miss, you can use a reaction to magically curve your shot and re-roll that attack against a different target that you can see within 60 feet of your attack's original target.

activation.condition: When you make an attack roll with a ranged Arcane Armory weapon and miss

subclassFeature.name: Ranged Transposition
entries: As an action, you can enchant a piece of ammunition with conjuration magic and fire it from a ranged {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1} weapon at a point you can see. When it comes to a stop, you instantly teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. If you have no uses left, you can expend a spell slot to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Elite Archer
entries: As a bonus action, you can enter a heightened state of arcane focus which grants you the following benefits:

items: Ranged attacks with your {@classFeature Arcane Armory|Magus|LLMC|1} weapons deal force damage in place of their normal damage.
You can use {@classFeature Ethereal Jaunt|Magus|LLMC|6} to teleport up to 10 feet after each ranged Arcane Armory attack you make.

When you hit a target with a ranged Arcane Armory attack, you can expend a spell slot to deal extra force damage to the target. This bonus damage is {@scaledamage 2d4|1-5|2d4} per level of the spell slot you expended.

entries: This heightened state lasts for 1 minute, but ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or you end it as a bonus action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. If you have no uses left, you can expend a 5th-level spell slot to enter this heightened state again.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Blade Dancers
entries: The Magi known as Blade Dancers dedicate their lives to the art of the Blade Dance. This mystical trance allows the Magi to empty their mind of all emotion and distraction to become one their blade. Masters of this trance are deadly whirlwinds of arcane power and savage steel in battle.
Typically, Magi of this Order take on a single apprentice, teaching them, and only them, the secrets of their Order.

entries.name: Blade Song & Dance
entries: The Order of Blade Dancers serves as the Magus' counterpart to the Wizard's {@class wizard||School of Bladesinging|bladesinging|tce}. While the abilities differ mechanically, the benefits of Blade Dance and {@subclassFeature Bladesong|Wizard||Bladesinging|tce|2} should not stack.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Dancer Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with an abjuration or transmutation spell of the same level from the Magus or Paladin spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Dance
entries: Your Order's style of combat is an art. You gain proficiency in {@skill Performance}, and you can use your Strength or Dexterity, in place of Charisma, when making a {@skill Performance} check.

So long as you are not wearing heavy armor or wielding a heavy weapon, you can use your bonus action to enter the trance known as the Blade Dance. This trance lasts for 1 minute, and while it is active, you gain the benefits below:

items: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
You gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.
When you roll damage for an attack or spell, you can roll the damage dice twice and use the higher result. Once you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn.
You add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to all Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.

entries: Your Blade Dance ends if you are {@condition incapacitated}, if you don heavy armor or a heavy weapon, or if you use a bonus action to end it. Once you enter a Blade Dance you must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again. When you have no uses of this feature remaining, you can expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to enter the Blade Dance again.

subclassFeature.name: Fluid Steps
entries: Your Order's emphasis on fluidity and martial skill has honed your reflexes. You gain proficiency in Dexterity saving throws, and you add your proficiency bonus to initiative rolls.
Also, your {@subclassFeature Blade Dance|Magus|LLMC|Blade Dancer|LLMC|3} Armor Class bonus becomes +2.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Dance
entries: You have become an expert of the {@subclassFeature Blade Dance|Magus|LLMC|Blade Dancer|LLMC|3}, and while you are in this trance you gain the additional benefits below:

items: Whenever you are forced to make a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage, you take no damage on a successful save, and only have damage on a failed save.
Whenever you use {@classFeature Spellsunder|Magus|LLMC|9}, you add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to the attack roll you make.
Your Blade Dance Armor Class bonus becomes +3.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Blades
entries: You have reached the apex of your Order and been granted the title of Master of Blades. You are always considered to be under the effects of your {@subclassFeature Blade Dance|Magus|LLMC|Blade Dancer|LLMC|3} so long as you are not wearing heavy armor or wielding a heavy weapon.
Also, when you take the {@action Attack} action while in your Blade Dance, you make one additional attack as part of that action.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Scales
entries: Magi of the legendary Order of Scales have their soul bound to a Draconic Companion. Using ancient magic, they infuse their Companion with draconic might beyond its years, and should their bond grow strong enough, they can mount their Draconic Companion, becoming a Dragon Knight of legend.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Spells
entries: When you gain a Magus level, you can replace one spell from this feature with an abjuration or evocation spell of the same level from the Magus or Sorcerer spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Companion
entries: Your soul has been bound to that of a Draconic Companion. You choose its Essence from the following options: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. Its Essence influences the color of its scales, and once it is chosen it cannot be changed.
Your Companion uses the {@creature Draconic Companion|LLMC} stat block on this page, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) and Magus Spell save DC throughout. It cannot bear a rider.

Your Draconic Companion is friendly to you and your allies and it obeys your commands. In combat, it acts on your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but it only takes the {@action Dodge} action on its turn unless you use a bonus action to order it to take an action from its stat block or another action. Also, whenever you take the {@action attack} action, you can forgo one of your attacks to command your Companion to attack. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, your Companion can act on its own, and it will defend both itself and you to the best of its abilities.

When your Companion is reduced to 0 hit points it makes death saving throws like a player character would. When it dies, you can perform a special 1-hour ritual, which can be during a short or long rest, that restores it to life with 1 hit point. As a part of this ritual, you can spend your Companion's hit dice so that it regains additional hit points equal to the hit dice rolled when it is returned to life.

subclassFeature.name: Wyrmsoul
entries: The bond has infused your soul with draconic power. You learn to speak, read, and write {@language Draconic}.

Also, if you cast a Magus spell that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can cause it to deal the damage type of your {@subclassFeature Draconic Companion|Magus|LLMC|Dragon Knight|LLMC|3||Companion's} Essence instead of its damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Companion
entries: As your power increases, so does that of your {@subclassFeature Draconic Companion|Magus|LLMC|Dragon Knight|LLMC|3||Companion}. Your Companion becomes Medium in size and can bear you as a rider so long as you are Medium or smaller. However, its flying speed is halved while you are riding it.
Your Companion's claw attacks also count as magical, and you roll {@dice d6}s in place of d4s for its Claw attack damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Breath
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Draconic Companion|Magus|LLMC|Dragon Knight|LLMC|3||Companion} can channel its Essence into a blast of pure elemental power. As an action, it can exhale a 30-foot cone of elemental breath. Targets in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Magus Spell save DC. Targets take {@damage 10d6} Essence damage on a failure, and half on a success.

Your Companion can use its Elemental Breath a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and it regains all expended uses when it finishes a long rest. If it has no uses left, you can expend a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher to command it to use its Elemental Breath again.

subclassFeature.name: Mythic Companion
entries: Your bond with your {@subclassFeature Draconic Companion|Magus|LLMC|Dragon Knight|LLMC|3||Companion} has unlocked its true power. As an action, your Companion can change its size, choosing to be Small, Medium, or Large. If it is Large in size, its flying speed is no longer halved while it bears you as its rider. Also, once per turn when you command your Companion to attack, it can make two attacks instead of one.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Dragon Knight
entries: Empowered by your bond, your {@subclassFeature Draconic Companion|Magus|LLMC|Dragon Knight|LLMC|3} has realized its true power. Your Companion uses the Exalted Companion stat block below in place of its previous statistics:

subclassFeature.name: Order of Shades
entries: A secretive Order of infiltrators, assassins, and spies, these Magi use their clandestine abilities to end conflicts before they begin. Known as Shades, these warriors specialize in illusion magic and thrive under cover of shadow. A Shade will only strike when they know their success is assured.

subclassFeature.name: Shade Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Magus level, you can replace one spell from this feature with a divination or illusion spell of your choice of the same level from the Magus or Wizard spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Shroud of Darkness
entries: As an action, you can envelop yourself in a Shroud of illusion magic, which lasts for 1 hour. While this Shroud is active, you can use a bonus action to turn {@condition invisible} if you are in an area of dim light or darkness. This invisibility lasts for the duration of your Shroud, but it ends early if you attack, touch, or force a creature to make an ability check or saving throw.

Once you conjure your Shroud you must complete a short or long rest before you can use your Shroud again. When you have no uses remaining, you can spend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to conjure your Shroud of Darkness again.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Sight
entries: You have trained to fight in the dark. You gain {@sense darkvision} to a range of 60 feet. If you have darkvision from another feature, the range of your darkvision increases by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: From the Shadows
entries: You are adept at bringing down foes when they are unaware. When you hit a creature that is {@quickref surprise||3||surprised} with a {@classFeature Spellstrike|Magus|LLMC|2} attack, it automatically fails its saving throw against the spell.
Moreover, if you use {@classFeature Ethereal Jaunt|Magus|LLMC|6} while you are in dim light or darkness, the distance you can teleport is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Shroud
entries: Your magic conceals you from creatures of shadow. If your {@subclassFeature Shroud of Darkness|Magus|LLMC|Shade|LLMC|3} is active while you are in darkness, you are {@condition invisible} to anything that relies on {@sense darkvision} to see you.

subclassFeature.name: Cloud the Mind
entries: You can penetrate the minds of your foes with your potent illusion magic. As an action, you can force one creature you can see within 30 feet to make an Intelligence saving throw against your Magus Spell save DC. On a failed save, it can't see, hear, smell, or sense you in any way for 1 minute. On a success, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours. This effect immediately ends if you attack, touch, or force the creature to make an ability check or saving throw.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all uses when you finish a long rest. When you have no uses left, you can expend a spell slot to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Darkness
entries: You have ascended to the apex of your Order and can become one with the darkness itself. You can conjure your {@subclassFeature Shroud of Darkness|Magus|LLMC|Shade|LLMC|3} at will, and while your Shroud is active you gain the benefits of both the {@spell invisibility} and {@spell pass without trace (alternate)|llspell|pass without trace} spells, without {@status concentration}.
Finally, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to teleport up to 60 feet to a space you can see that is in an area of dim light or darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Spellbreakers
entries: Magi who join the Order of Spellbreakers are known for their ruthless dedication to achieving their goals. This fraternity of arcane warriors and mage hunters use their Order's abilities to slay any who abuse magic power. While most Spellbreakers are discerning as they deliver judgment, some swear an oath to destroy any who utilize the arcane arts.

entries.name: Spellbreakers & other Mages
entries: While most Spellbreakers harbor a deep distrust for mages of all kinds, some are known work alongside other spellcasters to hunt down a dangerous foe.
If you are playing a Spellbreaker Magus and have a spellcaster in your party, make sure to come to an arrangement that allows you to work as a team.

subclassFeature.name: Spellbreaker Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with another enchantment or illusion spell of the same level from the Magus or Wizard spell list

rows: {@spell dispel evil and good|phb|dispel evil & good}, {@spell planar binding|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Baleful Mark
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can place a Baleful Mark on a creature you can see. This Mark lasts until you use this feature on another creature, the target dies, or it is removed by an equally powerful spell.
This Mark is only visible to you, and while it is active, you gain the benefits listed below:

items: You know the exact direction of your Mark, so long as you both remain on the same plane of existence.
You learn its spellcasting ability and the level of the highest level spell it can cast, if any.
If your Mark attempts to cast a spell while it is within your reach, you can use your reaction to make an opportunity attack against it.
Whenever you damage your Mark, it has disadvantage on its subsequent saving throw to maintain {@status concentration}.

subclassFeature.name: Mantle of Defense
entries: You can steel yourself to better resist the magic of your hated foes. Whenever your {@subclassFeature Baleful Mark|Magus|LLMC|Spellbreaker|LLMC|3||Mark} forces you to make a saving throw to resist a spell or another magical effect, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

activation.condition: Whenever your Mark forces you to make a saving throw to resist a spell or another magical effect

subclassFeature.name: Crippling Mark
entries: Whenever you see your Mark make an ability check or saving throw and you are within 30 feet, you can use your reaction to end your {@subclassFeature Baleful Mark|Magus|LLMC|Spellbreaker|LLMC|3} and impose disadvantage on its roll.
However, when you end your Baleful Mark in this way, you cannot Mark that creature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Reflective Spellsunder
entries: You can use the magic of your Order to reflect your enemy's magic back upon themselves. When you use {@classFeature Spellsunder|Magus|LLMC|9} and cause the spell to fail, you can force the creature that cast the spell to become the new target of their own spell.
The spell uses the caster's spell attack roll and Spell save DC. If it requires {@status concentration}, you must concentrate on it.

activation.condition: When you use Spellsunder and cause the spell to fail

subclassFeature.name: Master Spellbreaker
entries: You have risen through the ranks of your Order to become an unparalleled hunter of mages. You gain the benefits below:

items: When you roll initiative, so long as you are not {@quickref surprise||3||surprised}, you can mark a creature you can see with {@subclassFeature Baleful Mark|Magus|LLMC|Spellbreaker|LLMC|3}.
You have advantage on any weapon attack rolls you make as part of {@classFeature Spellstrike|Magus|LLMC|2} and {@classFeature Spellsunder|Magus|LLMC|9} against your Mark.

When you hit your Mark with a Spellstrike attack, you can end your Baleful Mark to cause your attack, including the spell, to deal maximum damage. After you do so, you can't Mark that creature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Warders
entries: Magi who join the Order of Warders almost always do so for noble reasons. Combing their talent for the arcane with their signature style of defensive combat to serve as guardians for mages, nobles, and other important figures. While they are ultimately loyal to their Order, Warders make fierce friends and will stand side by side with their allies against any foe.

subclassFeature.name: Warder Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with an abjuration or divination spell of the same level from either the Cleric or Magus spell list.

rows: {@spell mordenkainen's faithful hound||faithful hound}, {@spell death ward}

subclassFeature.name: Warder's Bond
entries: You are taught the signature protective style of your Order. You gain proficiency in heavy armor. Also, at the end of a long rest, you can touch a willing creature, forging a mystical bond that designates it as your Ward until your next long rest.

When your Ward is targeted by an attack or forced to make a saving throw and you are within 10 feet of it, you can use a reaction to instantly switch places and become the target of the triggering attack or effect. You must be able to see your Ward to use this reaction.
At certain Magus levels, the range of this reaction increases: at 7th level (30 feet), at 15th level (60 feet), and finally at 20th level the range is limited only by your line of sight.

activation.condition: At the end of a long rest

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Aegis
entries: You can temporarily infuse your {@subclassFeature Warder's Bond|Magus|LLMC|Warder|LLMC|3} with arcane power to absorb damage. When you use your Warder's Bond reaction and you take damage, you can expend a spell slot as part of the same reaction to reduce that damage by {@scaledice 2d8|1-5|2d8} per level of the spell slot you expended.
Moreover, whenever you start your turn within 10 feet of your Ward, you can grant one of you temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Bond Perfected
entries: The magic of your Bond has reached its apex. When you use your {@subclassFeature Warder's Bond|Magus|LLMC|Warder|LLMC|3} reaction you are considered resistant to any damage you take from the triggering attack or effect.

In addition, while you are within 10 feet of your Ward you are both immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions. If either of you is charmed or frightened and is within 10 feet of the other, the effects of the condition are temporarily suppressed, so long as you remain within 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: High Warder
entries: You have risen to the highest rank in the Order of Warders and stand as a stalwart arcane shield for any who are under your protection. At the end of each long rest, you can bond up to five willing creatures as your Wards with {@subclassFeature Warder's Bond|Magus|LLMC|Warder|LLMC|3}. All other rules for your Warder's Bond still apply for you.

Also, when you use your Warder's Bond reaction because your Ward was targeted by a spell, you can use {@classFeature Spellsunder|Magus|LLMC|9} as part of the same reaction. When you do so, you have advantage on your Spellsunder attack roll. If your Spellsunder fails, you can still use {@subclassFeature Arcane Aegis|Magus|LLMC|Warder|LLMC|7} to reduce the damage.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Wizard spell list, and Intelligence is your Spellcasting modifier for them.
At 2nd level, they become Magus spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Cantrips Known.

monster.name: Draconic Companion

hp.special: 5 + five times your Magus level (your Companion has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Magus level)

languages: understands any languages spoken by the Magus bound to it

trait.name: Hit Dice
entries: Your Companion has a total number of {@dice d8} Hit Dice equal to your Magus level. It also gains all the normal benefits of both short and long rests.

trait.name: Soul Bond
entries: You add your PB to any ability check or saving throw that your Draconic Companion makes.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +3 +PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d4 +3 +PB}) slashing damage + {@damage 1d4} Essence damage.

monster.name: Exalted Companion
languages: understands any languages spoken by the Magus bound to it.

trait.name: Hit Dice
entries: The Companion has a number of {@dice d10} Hit Dice equal to your Magus level. It also gains all the normal benefits of both short and long rests.

trait.name: Soul Bound
entries: You add your PB to any ability check or saving throw that your Draconic Companion makes.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d6 +5} magical slashing damage + {@damage 1d6} Essence damage.

action.name: Essence Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Your Companion can exhale elemental energy in a 30-foot cone, forcing any creatures in that area to make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures take {@damage 12d6} Essence damage on a failure, and half as much damage on a success.
This replaces your {@subclassFeature Elemental Breath|Magus|LLMC|Dragon Knight|LLMC|15} feature.
